intro: Mansoa longicalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf or longiclad velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically borne on long, slender peduncles. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Mansoa longicalyx is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
